isis.stitle: DT/DTA-466 Diesel Engine Service (1990) - LUBRICATING OIL PUMP, OIL FILTERS AND COOLER - OIL COOLER AND COOLANT FILTER HEADER ASSEMBLY - REASSEMBLY

step1.para: If applied, assemble the current coolant filter header to the oil cooler as follows:

step2.para:
Install new square cut seal rings (one large and one small) at the coolant filter header. Refer to Figure 9.38
. Hold in place with grease.

step1.para:
Fasten the current coolant filter header to the oil cooler using the three "patch" bolts with hardened washers. Tighten to the standard torque. Refer to Figure 9.39
.

Install new O-Rings on the coolant filter header to front cover tubes. Refer to Figure 9.4
.
Lubricate the O-Rings and the front cover and header tube mating surfaces with a suitable grease.
Install the tubes into the header.

figure.caption: Figure 9.37. Oil Cooler Pressure Test for Leakage.
Figure 9.38. Coolant Filter Header Seal Ring Locations.

note.para: On early style oil coolers install and lubricate new O-Rings on the cooler to front cover tubes. Install the tubes into the cooler. Refer to Figure 9.40.

step1.para: Install a new coolant filter as follows:

step2.para: Apply a thin coat of coolant to the filter gasket and install onto the filter header.
Tighten filter until gasket touches coolant filter header.
Tighten filter by hand, one (1) additional full turn.

figure.caption: Figure 9.39. Coolant Filter Header to Oil Cooler Installation.
Figure 9.40. Early Style Oil Cooler Tube Installation

step1.para:
Using new gaskets, install the oil cooler or oil cooler and coolant filter assembly to the crankcase and front cover. Fasten the oil cooler to the crankcase using the special "patch" bolts and hardened washers to avoid leakage at the cooler. Tighten the bolts to the standard torque. (See Appendix.) Refer to Figure 9.41
.

figure.caption: Figure 9.41. Install Oil Cooler and Coolant Filter Header.
